Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
02/08/2022. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the ISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department of human
services, the equivalent state or Canadian provincial agency, or
equivalent agency in the country where the person usually
resides, that the person has not been determined to be a
perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect. The documentation
shall be completed not more than 30 days prior to the start of
employment and every 12 months thereafter.
Five out of six personnel records hired over one year contained late annual updates
to central registry clearances by two, three (three staff), and six months.
Eleven out of thirteen personnel records hired under one year contained central
registry clearances completed more than 30 days prior to the start of employment by
one week, two weeks (two staff), three weeks (five staff), and one month (three
staff).
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee's performance within
30 days of the completion of the probationary period or within
180 days, whichever is less, and a written evaluation of the
employee’s performance annually thereafter.
Three out of six personnel records hired over one year were deficient with annual
performance evaluations. Last performance evaluations occurred on 12/17/2019,
08/31/2020, and 09/26/2020.

The facility is not contracted with the DHHS and not subject to DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility submitted three appropriate corrective action plan during this report
period.
SIR#2020C0325029 initiated on 02/12/2020 cited the facility for its line-of-sight policy.
The corrective action plan included policy revision regarding supervision expectations
during transportation and staff training. The corrective action plan appears to have
been successful as no repeat citations have occurred.
5

SIR#2020C0420029 initiated on 05/18/2020 cited the facility for restraint protocol in
de-escalation, technique, and being proportionate to the severity of the behavior. The
corrective action plan included disciplinary action of staff, refresher in Crisis
Prevention and Intervention training for staff involved, and all staff annually, and
review of the emergency rules pertaining to prone and other restraints for all staff.
SIR#2021C0325037 initiated on 09/03/2021 cited the facility for restraint technique
and child protection law requirements. The corrective action plan included the
termination of staff involved, annual refresher training on Crisis Prevention and
Intervention with all staff, as well as revising its child protection law policy to include
training with all staff.
Interim inspection report dated 04/06/2021 contained no citations.
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
